page.title: 17BYPASS:KILDWICK ROUNDABOUT
page.content: In 1975 it was decided that an 11 mile long bypass was needed in the Aire Valley to relieve the existing roads of heavy traffic. The new road would reduce accidents on the narrow Kildwick Bridge and also noise levels in the local villages. The main objection locally was of the proposed roundabout at Kildwick to link the villages with the road. The inhabitants complained that traffic flows in Crosshills would increase due to the roundabout and therefore pedestrians' lives would be endangered. An inquiry was held in 1980 to investigate the problems but it was decided that the roundabout would still be built. It was stated that construction would start in 1983 but in 1985 this has yet to happen.
